result.execSummary:
The defendant Korre K. Morse was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall have no contact with the victim.  Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim due within 30 days of sentencing and preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Korre K. Morse

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation
DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant Korre K. Morse in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied.  Plea of no contest  to count 2 - disorderly conduct- domestic.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 2.  Court orders withheld sentence probation for a period of 2 years with conditions; no contact with victim; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology due within 30 days of sentencing to be preapproved by probation; no possession or consumption of alcohol; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  One day of sentence credit. - rt

Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Korre K. Morse in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz by phone.  Defendant Korre K. Morse in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 09:15 am.  - rt

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Korre K. Morse appeared, in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requested a $1,000.00 signature bond; booking and no contact with  E.A.D. - dob:  12-6-84 and no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Next court date is May 19, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant shall have no contact with E.A.D. - dob: 12-6-84
